data.name: Count IPv6 Addresses (ruby only)
data.description:
Write a method that calculates the number of IPv6 addresses between two given IPv6 addresses, excluding the end IP address.

All input to the `ipv6_between` method will be two valid IPv6 addresses in the form of a `String`.  The last address will always be equal to or at least one address higher than the first one.  The method should also be case-insensitive.

**Examples:**
```ruby
ipv6_between("fe80::1", "fe80::2") # => 1
ipv6_between("FE80:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0001", "FE80:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0002") # => 1
```

**Note:** Make sure your solution accounts for leading zeros, groups of zeros, and dotted-quad notation as described here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6_address
